result.advice: Since your banana plant Banana is in the seedling stage (1-3 months old) and you haven t detected any flowers or fruit, it is likely in the vegetative stage. At this stage, focus on promoting strong, healthy growth. Here s what you should do: Nutrients: Banana plants in the seedling stage need high potassium and nitrogen. Use a fertilizer that is rich in these nutrients. Watering: Ensure the soil is consistently moist but not waterlogged. Sunlight: Provide ample sunlight. Soil: Make sure the plant is in well-draining soil. Keep an eye out for pests and diseases, and address them promptly if they appear.
